body: I searched in here for similar issues and found https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/8172 - which sounds very similar. Although the patch already seems to be applied in `master`.

Ive tried again, this time using protoc-3.3.0 but get the same error.

```
 make
protoc -I ../../protos --cpp_out=. ../../protos/route_guide.proto
g++ -std=c++11 `pkg-config --cflags protobuf grpc`  -c -o route_guide.pb.o route_guide.pb.cc
/bin/sh: 1: pkg-config: not found
In file included from route_guide.pb.cc:5:0:
route_guide.pb.h:9:42: fatal error: google/protobuf/stubs/common.h: No such file or directory
 #include <google/protobuf/stubs/common.h>
                                          ^
compilation terminated.
<builtin>: recipe for target 'route_guide.pb.o' failed
make: *** [route_guide.pb.o] Error 1
rm route_guide.pb.cc
```

I tried the advice mentioned on https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/9260#issuecomment-270744978 - and now I get the below error.

The commands that I ran are:

```
git clone -b $(curl -L https://grpc.io/release) https://github.com/grpc/grpc
cd grpc
git submodule update --init
make
make install

cd third_party/protobuf
./autogen.sh
./configure
make
make check
make install
```



**Error**

```
 make
protoc -I ../../protos --cpp_out=. ../../protos/route_guide.proto
g++ -std=c++11 `pkg-config --cflags protobuf grpc`  -c -o route_guide.pb.o route_guide.pb.cc
/bin/sh: 1: pkg-config: not found
protoc -I ../../protos --grpc_out=. --plugin=protoc-gen-grpc=`which grpc_cpp_plugin` ../../protos/route_guide.proto
g++ -std=c++11 `pkg-config --cflags protobuf grpc`  -c -o route_guide.grpc.pb.o route_guide.grpc.pb.cc
/bin/sh: 1: pkg-config: not found
g++ -std=c++11 `pkg-config --cflags protobuf grpc`  -c -o route_guide_client.o route_guide_client.cc
/bin/sh: 1: pkg-config: not found
g++ -std=c++11 `pkg-config --cflags protobuf grpc`  -c -o helper.o helper.cc
/bin/sh: 1: pkg-config: not found
g++ route_guide.pb.o route_guide.grpc.pb.o route_guide_client.o helper.o -L/usr/local/lib `pkg-config --libs protobuf grpc++` -Wl,--no-as-needed -lgrpc++_reflection -Wl,--as-needed -ldl -o route_guide_client
/bin/sh: 1: pkg-config: not found
/usr/bin/ld: route_guide_client.o: undefined reference to symbol 'pthread_create@@GLIBC_2.1'
//lib/i386-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0: error adding symbols: DSO missing from command line
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
Makefile:42: recipe for target 'route_guide_client' failed
make: *** [route_guide_client] Error 1
rm route_guide.grpc.pb.cc route_guide.pb.cc

```

I'm running into the same issue trying to build gRPC now. I'm going to try an earlier release.

I run these commands
```
git clone -b $(curl -L https://grpc.io/release) https://github.com/grpc/grpc
cd grpc
git submodule update --init
make
make install

cd third_party/protobuf
./autogen.sh
./configure
make
make check
make install
```

then make in examples/cpp/helloworld

result:

```
No package 'grpc' found
/opt/rh/devtoolset-6/root/usr/libexec/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/6.3.1/ld: helloworld.grpc.pb.o: undefined reference to symbol '_ZN4grpc24g_core_codegen_interfaceE'
//usr/local/lib/libgrpc++.so.1: error adding symbols: DSO missing from command line
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make: *** [greeter_client] Error 1
```

After I set PKG_CONFIG_PATH, make succeed.
```
export PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/usr/local/lib/pkgconfig
```

I just had the same issue - v1.8.x

I also had to run:
```
cd third_party/protobuf
./autogen.sh
./configure
make
make check
make install
```
After installing grpc to ensure that the protoc development files where also installed - they were not by default.

I have yet to also get `pkgconfig` to work in Makefiles either.

Sounds like a mismatch in protoc version installed. Isn't the latest protoc version 3.5.0 (the wget command is fetching 3.4)?  The submodule that comes with 1.8.x. Does the `wget` command in the original post come from our guidelines? If so, let us know and we fix our guides. Otherwise, on machines without protoc installed, installation should work fine. On machines with a different version of protoc installed, there might be glitches.
I'm not sure how there could be a mismatch - exactly like OP, this is a clean install on a Docker image - there is no protoc installed.

@markmandel have you by any chance tried running make once before fetching submodules first? (sometimes that pollutes the tree and `make clean` becomes necessary) If not, what is your docker base image distro/version so I can try reproduction?

So there are several issues at play here:

1) On https://grpc.io/docs/quickstart/cpp.html the install from source guide doesn't match up to the grpc install from source at all. It should likely be removed. It also states "If you don’t already have it installed on your system" - which makes it sound like you don't need to install protoc from source, which to use C++, it looks like you absolutely have to, otherwise you are missing dependencies like header files. This should also be clarified.

2) Here is a Dockerfile for reporoduction, if you build this, you will see that common.h is not available in /usr/lib/includes anywhere, and also `pkg-configure` does not work.

```Dockerfile
FROM debian:latest

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git build-essential autoconf libtool pkg-config

ENV GRPC_VER v1.8.x
RUN git clone -b ${GRPC_VER} --depth=3 https://github.com/grpc/grpc && \
    cd grpc && \
    git submodule update --init && \
    make && \
    make install
```
From here, let's `docker build --tag=cpp-grpc .` and then `docker run --rm -it cpp-grpc bash` so we can hop into a shell.

```shell
➜  docker run --rm -it cpp-grpc bash
root@c3a1d4d2e03d:/# ls /usr/local/include/
grpc  grpc++
root@c3a1d4d2e03d:/#
```
As you can see, there are none of the google/protobuf dependencies in here.

pkg-config also fails:

```shell
root@4134f2ef79d0:/# pkg-config --cflags protobuf grpc
Package protobuf was not found in the pkg-config search path.
Perhaps you should add the directory containing `protobuf.pc'
to the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable
No package 'protobuf' found
```
Since this environment variable doesn't seem to be set. But even if I set it, it still fails, because there is no protobuf package in /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig
Oh, I originally thought the gRPC build fails too... you are only talking about examples, make sense now.
If anyone gets a pkg-config after getting through all this on a mac, then just `brew install pkg-config` and thank the gods.
